title: Binky Felstead turns heads in spotty dark green evening gown as she shows off daughter India
text:
Binky Felstead turned heads in a spotty green frilly dress as she attended a talk on motherhood in Mayfair on Thursday.

And the former Made In Chelsea star, 29, appeared in high spirits as she stepped out with daughter India, two, at The AllBright private members' club in Mayfair to attend a talk on motherhood.

The Mummy Tribe founder posed for snaps in her maxi dress as she posed on a rooftop at the venue.

Looking radiant: Binky Felstead put parenting to the forefront as she attended a talk on motherhood on Thursday at The AllBright private members club in Mayfair

The reality star complemented her flowing dress with a hooped gold belt which hung loosely around her waist.

And a black Gucci shoulder bag and a pair of pristine white Veja trainers rounded off the stylish ensemble.

India was dressed for the occasion in a cute collared cardigan and pale jeans, with the tot looking at home in her mother's arms.

Binky, who recently found love again after her split from India's father Josh 'JP' Patterson, was teaming with technology brand Elvie.

Proud mother: The reality star complemented her flowing dress with a hooped gold belt and a black Gucci shoulder bag while India was dressed in a cute collared cardigan and jeans

It further promoted Mummy Tribe, which organises retreats for new mothers and was founded after her daughter was born.

It comes after the star made her first public appearance with new man Max Fredrik Darnton at the launch of Gordon Ramsey's new restaurant Lucky Cat last month.

Binky appeared to have remained single since her split from Josh last September and had not previously announced any love interest.

During their relationship Binky and Josh welcomed India, but subsequently split when they realised they were better off as friends.
description: Binky Felstead put parenting to the forefront on Thursday as she stepped out with daughter India, two, at The AllBright private members club in Mayfair to discuss issues new mothers are having.
